head.title: A Fall Line In Full Color

hedline.hl1: A Fall Line In Full Color

abstract.p: Paris fashion firm Renato Nucci opens its first retail store in US, on Spring Street in lower Manhattan; photo (New Yorkers & Co column) (S)

block.p: Renato Nucci, the Paris fashion company, opened its first retail store in the United States last month at 131 Spring Street (between Greene and Wooster Streets) in SoHo. The store is showing the fall line, which emphasizes pastels, includes a multicolored tweed wool suit for $740 (the jacket costs $520 and the 24-inch skirt $220). One of the store's best-selling suits is made mostly of purple and yellow silk with velvet fringes, and costs $555. The store also offers accessories that complement the clothing line.

''Even though there are a lot of embellishments in the products,'' the shop's co-owner, Emanuel Fresko, said of Mr. Nucci's designs, ''he's always careful to keep the clothing tasteful.''
